content.description: Simple Traverse along the first boulder in the cluster. Start at the lower left side, work your way up and to the right all the way shuffling hands along the upward facing arete.

Sit start down and right of Jetstream

 Left hand on a slopey crimp knob, right hand on a small shark tooth undercling

 Pull on and throw left hand for the good arete of JetstreamÂ

Sit start on a pad with matching hands on an semi obvious start hold low in the crack. Bump to a right hand that allows you to move your left hand further up the crack and stand up. Continue left along the crack into the top out. You may or may not need to use the far left arete to stabilize yourself before going to the top out holds.

 Good movement. Crux is getting up into the left crack from the sitstart.
content.protection: A few pads. An attentive spotter to make sure you don't smack your head into the tree.
content.location: Coming from Diamond ledge up the hill walk around to the right side of the cluster. This problem is located on one of the top right boulders. 15 feet up hill from the boulder that has the problem "Acid Rain" on it.

content.description: Stand start on the good jugs and work your way up. The right side cracked part of the boulder that seperated this section from the Acid Rain/Jetstream Section is on for the V1 variation.
content.protection: A few pads and attentive spotter
content.location: The boulder section containing this problem is located to the left of "Jetstream" and "Acid Rain". Approach from the right side of the cluster, be careful of any loose rock in the landing zone.

content.description: Start low with the same left crimp and right horn as "Acid Rain". Ultra short problem up and over the low side of the boulder. Bump a high right foot, hit lip with hands, reach far for the good on top side of boulder to top it out.
content.location: Far right side of the "Acid Rain Boulder" section. The top out basically puts you right next to where the Problem "Cherry Pop" starts.

content.description:
Match hands on the Arete with one decent foothold and work your way up using both the slope and the few good pockets on the right side of the face.

 This problem is used to get a feel for the topout on Acid Rain.
content.location: On the upper right side of the cluster.

content.description: Stand-start on the far left side of the boulder "Sober Soda" is located on. Starting holds on the artete. Use the good foothold to make a quick move to the handhold up and to the right. Finish at the same V shaped dip in the rock as "Sober Soda".
content.location: Find the boulder by walking around the right side of the cluster. This boulder is the furthest uphill boulder to the right. The problem starts all the way on the left side, on the arete.

content.description: Start on the far right side of boulder. Left hand on a crimp, right hand on a small horn. Go low and traverse all the way left. Grab the arete with the left hand to gain balance and finish the climb by going up the slope. Easy topout.
content.location: Boulder is on right side of cluster just before the sober soda boulder.

content.description: The most well traveled boulders exist in the cluster. The quality of these routes vary, some being are well worth the climb while others are choss.
